intro: Biscutella didyma var. muscaroidora, commonly known as the muscaroid orchid, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that resemble those of orchids. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its botanical features include small, lance-shaped leaves and a distinctive floral structure with a long, narrow spur. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
